spell.name: Aura of Eternal Twilight (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (1 oz. of moss from an ancient tree)
spell.classes: School: Abjuration, Bard, Cleric, Ranger, Warlock, Wizard
spell.text:
You emit an aura that empowers the fey. While within 30 feet of you, the area becomes dim and filled with flickering motes like stars and any fey ally of yours makes saving throws with advantage, and that ally regains 1d6 hit points whenever it starts its turn there.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, a fey ally regains an additional 1d6 hit points for each slot above 2nd level.
Source: Tasha's Scrapped Book p. 43 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Bad To Worse (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a burnt four-leaf clover)
spell.classes: School: Enchantment, Bard, Cleric, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard
spell.text:
When any creature of your choice within 60 feet of you makes an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw with disadvantage, it must reroll one of the dice once, taking the lowest result of the three rolls.
Source: Tasha's Scrapped Book p. 43 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Befuddle (HB)
spell.classes: School: Enchantment, Bard, Ranger, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard
spell.text:
Up to three creatures of your choice that you can see within range must make Charisma saving throws. Whenever a target that fails this saving throw takes a Move or Dash action, it moves in a random direction.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.
Source: Tasha's Scrapped Book p. 43 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Blinding Flare (HB)
spell.classes: School: Evocation, Artificer, Cleric, Druid, Paladin, Ranger, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard
spell.text:
As a part of this spell, make an attack with a weapon that deals fire or lightning damage. Each creature within 30 feet of the place where the attack makes contact must make a Constitution saving throw or be blinded. Creatures you designate have advantage on this saving throw. This spell has no effect on creatures without eyes, creatures that do not use their eyes to see, or creatures that have other means of sight besides their eyes. An affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of their turns, ending the effects on itself on a success.
Source: Tasha's Scrapped Book p. 43 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Capture Spell (HB)
spell.time: 1 reaction, which you take when you become aware of a creature within range casting a spell
spell.classes: School: Abjuration, Artificer, Bard, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard
spell.text:
Make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC equals 10 + the level of the triggering spell. On a success, the creature's spell is captured by you. The spell has no effect, other than to be "stored" in you, but the resources (spell slot, components, etc.) are used as normal. You can cast a spell "stored" in you. The spell uses the slot level, spell save DC, spell attack bonus, and spellcasting ability of the original caster, but is otherwise treated as if you cast the spell. Once cast, the spell is no longer "stored" in you.
Source: Tasha's Scrapped Book p. 44 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Control Fey (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (10 gp worth of amber from a treant)
spell.classes: School: Enchantment, Bard, Cleric, Paladin, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard
spell.text:
You attempt to take control of a fey creature that you can see within range. It must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be controlled by you for the duration. If you or creatures that are friendly to you are fighting it, it has advantage on the saving throw. While the fey creature is controlled, you have a telepathic link with it as long as the two of you are on the same plane of existence. You can use this telepathic link to issue commands to the creature while you are conscious (no action required), which it does its best to obey. You can specify a simple and general course of action, such as "Attack that creature," "Run over there," or "Fetch that object." If the creature completes the order and doesn't receive further direction from you, it defends and preserves itself to the best of its ability. You can use your action to take total and precise control of the target. Until the end of your next turn, the creature takes only the actions you choose, and doesn't do anything that you don't allow it to do. During this time, you can also cause the creature to use a reaction, but this requires you to use your own reaction as well. Each time the target takes damage, it makes a new Wisdom saving throw against the spell. If the saving throw succeeds, the spell ends.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the duration increases by 1 hour for each slot above 4th level.
Source: Tasha's Scrapped Book p. 44 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Elementalist's Alteration (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a magical weapon that deals acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage, worth at least 100gp)
spell.classes: School: Transmutation, Artificer, Druid, Sorcerer, Wizard
spell.text:
As a part of this spell, make an attack with a weapon that deals acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage. Without changing the amount of the damage, change the type of the damage to acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage.
Source: Tasha's Scrapped Book p. 44 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Fumble Touch (HB)
spell.classes: School: Enchantment, Artificer, Bard, Ranger, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard
spell.text:
A creature that you can see within range must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the creature makes attack rolls with disadvantage for the duration of the spell. If the creature makes an attack roll and misses, the creature rolls a do to determine what happens: 1-2: creature falls prone (if it is immune to the prone condition, its speed becomes 0 until the start of its next turn); 3-4: the creature drops its weapon (if it can't, it falls prone); 5-6: each creature within reach can use its reaction to make an opportunity attack against the creature.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.
Source: Tasha's Scrapped Book p. 44 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Imbue Creatures of the Nature (HB)
spell.classes: School: Enchantment, Druid, Paladin, Ranger
spell.text:
Your magic imbues your beastly minions and fey servitors. Choose up to 2 CR worth of beasts or fey within 90 feet of you. This can be any combination of CR 1/4, 1/2, 1, or 2. The chosen creatures gain a bonus to AC, ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws equal to your proficiency bonus.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you imbue an additional 1 CR worth of beasts or fey for each slot above 3rd level.
Source: Tasha's Scrapped Book p. 44 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Infernal Contract (HB)
spell.components: V, M (100gp worth of magical inks, which the spell consumes)
spell.classes: School: Enchantment, Bard, Cleric, Warlock, Wizard, Warlock (Fiend)
spell.text:
Monsters: Hags, Devils, Archmages, Liches, Warlocks of the Fiend (at will, as ritual)
Invoking the laws of the Pact Primeval, you bind willing creatures into a contract which ensures everyone involved upholds their end of the bargain. In preparation for you casting the spell, each entity to be involved with and bound by the contract must willingly provide a vial of its own blood, which is then mixed with ink. The magical ink used to draft this contract cannot be made invisible, glows red, and is warm to the touch. Additionally, any text written with this ink can be understood by entities whose blood has been used in the ink's creation, regardless of the language or handwriting style used. The spell can only be cast if all entities whose blood is mixed with the ink have signed it with their true names. Whenever a clause is added or removed, any existing signature disappears. If a creature has less than 8 Intelligence, Wisdom and/or Charisma at the moment the spell is cast, if it has been coerced by force, threats or magic into signing, or if it signs with anything other than its true name, the magic does not take hold, and the spell's components are wasted. The contract bursts in flames after it is signed by all involved parties. From the moment the contract is in effect to the moment it is terminated, all involved parties can magically summon or dismiss a copy of the contract into existence as an action. Unless specified otherwise, the contract is terminated when one of the parties dies. The contract must contain at least the following two elements: commitments and exit clauses.
Commitments: Each party involved makes one or more promises to the other parties. If one of the commitments is not met, then the contract is terminated, and the exit clause for the party who failed to deliver on their promise is invoked. This magical contract allows you to do transactions that could not be performed without magic. However, the contract cannot allow you to give something you do not possess. Here are examples of possible commitments:
• Arcane Power. You give the recipient some of the spells you know, and some of your spell slots. The recipient can cast those spells, using those spell slots. They use their own spellcasting ability modifier, using the same Ability Score you would have used to cast those spells. These spells and spell slots are not available to you anymore, until the contract is terminated. This is often what is offered to Warlocks.
• Memory. The recipient is given your memory of an event. The contract may let you keep a copy of these memories, or they are lost to you until the contract is terminated. This is often used in courts, to ensure the veracity of a testimony.
• A sense. You can decide to either give, or share a sense with another party. If you give your sense of sight to a blind person, they will regain their vision, but you will lose yours. You could decide to share a sense instead. If you do, the blind person will not regain their vision-instead, they will see everything that you see, from your point of view, until the contract is terminated.
• A favor. You can specify a task to be completed before a certain date. Alternatively, you can specify a number of favors to be reclaimed later.
• Your eternal soul. If an entity possesses your soul, they can summon your soul within 30 feet of them as an action, or dismiss your soul back to where it was before you were summoned in the same way. They can read your thoughts, and have access to all of your memories. You are unable to disobey any verbal or telepathic command they give you, and they know if you tell them a lie. Finally, while your soul is forfeit, you cannot sign any additional infernal contract.
Unless specified otherwise within the contract, when the contract is terminated for any reason, the contract magically returns any item, experience, memory, sense, favor, or soul that had been given to their original owners. If a commitment can be interpreted in different ways, the party who makes the commitment decides which interpretation is correct when they make it.
Exit Clauses: You must describe what happens to each party should they fail to deliver on their commitments within the agreed upon timeframe. Again, the contract can enforce things through the use of magic that would otherwise be impossible. Here are examples of common exit clauses:
• Curse. The faulty party receives a curse, as per the bestow curse spell, as if it had been cast as a 9th level spell. They fail the saving throw automatically.
• Recall. The faulty party is teleported to the location where the contract was signed.
• Imprisonment. The faulty party is imprisoned, as per the imprisonment spell, for a duration to be specified. They fail the saving throw automatically.
• Compensation. The faulty party makes a new commitment as a penalty. For example, the party could have their ability to speak taken away as punishment.
• Punishment. The faulty party suffers one of the effects of the symbol spell. They fail the saving throw automatically.
A wish spell can be used to terminate the contract without being subjected to its exit clauses. If an exit clause can be interpreted in different ways, the parties who did not fail their commitments decide which interpretation is correct when the exit clause is invoked. Long ago, the Fey collectively signed an infernal contract which made it so their word became magically binding. Because of this, any promise or agreement made orally to or by a fey creature instantly results in the casting of this spell, with clauses determined automatically.
Source: Tasha's Scrapped Book p. 45 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Jinx (HB)
spell.time: 1 reaction, which you take when a creature within range rolls with advantage
spell.classes: School: Enchantment, Bard, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard
spell.text:
When a creature within 30 feet that you can see makes an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw with advantage, you can use your reaction to remove advantage from the attack roll, ability check, or saving throw.
Source: Tasha's Scrapped Book p. 46 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Mark of the Companion (HB)
spell.classes: School: Transmutation, Touch Spells, Cleric, Druid, Ranger
spell.text:
You can use this magic as a means of transporting bonded creature companions, blending in with busy city streets, or hiding them away during stealthy endeavours. As an action, you can touch a willing creature with a CR up to 1/3 of your level and absorb their essence into your body. For as long as you concentrate up to 8 hours (or until you use an action to end the effect early) the companion appears on your body as a mark that relates to them. This can be a claw scar, an eagle tattoo, or even a birthmark in the shape of an otter. You can choose a new appearance every time you cast this spell. While absorbed this way, the companion sees what you see and can communicate telepathically with you as if they were walking right alongside you. When the spell ends, the creature appears in the nearest unoccupied space of your choice.
Source: Tasha's Scrapped Book p. 46 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Misadventure (HB)
spell.classes: School: Abjuration, Bard, Cleric, Ranger, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard
spell.text:
You extrude an aura of ill luck. You have the option to make any attack roll, ability check, or saving throw during this spell's duration with disadvantage. Each time you do, creatures you designate within 30 feet of you also have disadvantage on the next attack roll, ability check, or saving throw that they make within the next 1 minute.
Source: Tasha's Scrapped Book p. 46 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Misfortune (HB)
spell.classes: School: Enchantment, Bard, Sorcerer, Wizard
spell.text:
Creatures (including yourself) within 30 feet that you can see make ability checks, attack rolls, or saving throws at disadvantage.
Source: Tasha's Scrapped Book p. 47 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Partial Absorption (HB)
spell.time: 1 reaction, which you take when you
spell.classes: School: Abjuration, Artificer, Bard, Cleric, Druid, Paladin, Ranger
spell.text:
When you or a creature within 30 feet of you takes damage from a spell or magical effect, you can use your reaction to grant yourself or another creature within 30 feet of you resistance to damage from spells and other magical effects for that instance of damage.
Source: Tasha's Scrapped Book p. 47 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Possession (HB)
spell.classes: School: Transmutation, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard
spell.text:
You can attempt to possess a creature by transforming into a pure spiritual force to take control of it. One humanoid that you can see within 5 feet of you must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be possessed by you; you then disappear, and the target is incapacitated and loses control of its body. You now control the body but don't deprive the target of awareness. You can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, except ones that turn undead, and you retain your alignment, Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma, and class abilities and features. You otherwise use the possessed target's statistics, but don't gain access to the target's knowledge, features, or proficiencies. The possession lasts until the body drops to 0 hit points, you end it as a bonus action, or you are turned or forced out by an effect such as dispel evil and good. When the possession ends, you reappear in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the body in your true form. The target is immune to this spell for 24 hours after succeeding on the saving throw or after the spell ends.
Source: Tasha's Scrapped Book p. 47 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Shared Destiny (HB)
spell.classes: School: Enchantment, Bard, Cleric, Paladin, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard
spell.text:
You weave a thread that binds a creature's life to your own, shielding you and channeling harm to the creature. You target one creature you can see within 30 feet of you. A crackling cord of variegated energy tethers you to the target. Whenever you take damage, the target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, you take half the damage (rounded down), and the target takes the remaining damage.
Source: Tasha's Scrapped Book p. 48 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Speak with Monsters (HB)
spell.classes: School: Divination, Artificer, Bard, Cleric, Druid, Paladin, Ranger, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard
spell.text:
This spell allows you to communicate with a monster (designated by you when you cast the spell) as if you both shared a language.
Source: Tasha's Scrapped Book p. 48 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Spell Eater (HB)
spell.time: 1 reaction, which you take when you see a creature within 90 feet of you casting a spell
spell.classes: School: Abjuration, Bard, Cleric, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard
spell.text:
You can use your reaction to absorb a spell that you and only you are the target of. The absorbed spell's effect is canceled, and you either regain a number of temporary hit points equal to five times the level of the spell or you end one condition affecting you.
Source: Tasha's Scrapped Book p. 48 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Terror Strike (HB)
spell.classes: School: Enchantment, Artificer, Cleric, Druid, Paladin, Warlock, Wizard
spell.text:
As a part of this spell, make a melee attack with a weapon available to you. When you roll your attack roll, also roll 5d8; the total is how many hit points of creatures this spell can affect. All the creatures of your choice within 90 feet of you are affected in ascending order of their current hit points. Starting with the creature that has the lowest current hit points, each creature affected by this spell becomes frightened of you until either the spell ends or when they succeed on a wisdom saving throw against this spell. A creature can attempt this saving throw at the end of each of their turns, ending the effects on themselves on a success. Subtract each creature's hit points from the total before moving on to the creature with the next lowest hit points. A creature's hit points must be equal to or less than the remaining total for that creature to be affected.
At Higher Levels: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, roll an extra 2d8 for each spell slot above 1st.
Source: Tasha's Scrapped Book p. 48 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Wall of Mud (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a ball of clay)
spell.classes: School: Conjuration, Druid, Ranger, Wizard
spell.text:
You create a wall of clinging clay. You choose to make the wall up to 30 feet long, 10 feet high, and 5 feet thick, or a circle that has a 20-foot diameter and is up to 20 feet high and 5 feet thick. The wall blocks line of sight. The terrain 10 feet around each section of the wall becomes thick with sticky clay, creating difficult terrain. Moving through an affected square consumes 3 feet of movement per 1 foot moved. Each 5-foot-square wall section has AC 10 and 10 hit points. Reducing a section to 0 hit points destroys that section and removes the difficult terrain in a 5-foot-radius around it.
Source: Tasha's Scrapped Book p. 48 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Weave Access (HB)
spell.classes: School: Enchantment, Artificer, Bard, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard
spell.text:
You draw the Weave to yourself to connect to the very essence of magic. Whenever you make an Arcana check, a concentration check, or an ability check using your spellcasting ability, you can roll a d6 and add the number rolled to the check.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can add +1 to the check or roll for each slot above 2nd level.
Source: Tasha's Scrapped Book p. 49 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Well of Levitation (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a feather and tuning fork)
spell.classes: School: Transmutation, Cleric, Sorcerer, Wizard
spell.text:
Select a 20-foot square within range. Each creature in the chosen area must make a Constitution saving throw or rise vertically, up to 20 feet, and remain suspended there for the duration. The spell can levitate targets that weigh up to 1000 pounds. The target can move only by pushing or pulling against a fixed object or surface within reach (such as a wall or a ceiling), which allows it to move as if it were climbing. As a bonus action, you can choose to lower or raise each creature in the area by 20 feet and up to 60 feet into the air. If you are the target, you can move up or down as part of your move. Otherwise, you can use your bonus action to move the target, which must remain within the spell's range. When the spell ends, the target floats gently to the ground if it is still aloft.
Source: Tasha's Scrapped Book p. 49 (Homebrew)
